alert.note: Alert for Boone; Bracken; Campbell; Carroll; Gallatin; Grant; Kenton; Owen; Pendleton (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 29 at 5:23PM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF EAST CENTRAL SWITZERLAND, KENTON, BOONE, EASTERN CARROLL, NORTHWESTERN BRACKEN, CAMPBELL, GRANT, OWEN, PENDLETON, GALLATIN, SOUTHERN BUTLER, WESTERN CLERMONT, HAMILTON AND SOUTHWESTERN WARREN COUNTIES THROUGH 600 PM EDT... At 522 PM EDT, strong thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Hamilton to near Union to 7 miles northeast of New Castle, moving east at 50 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Cincinnati, Hamilton, Middletown, Fairfield, Covington, Mason, Florence, Independence, Lebanon, Norwood, Forest Park, Erlanger, Fort Thomas, Newport, Sharonville, Monroe, Blue Ash, Loveland, Trenton and Springdale. This includes the following Interstates... I-71 in Kentucky between mile markers 51 and 77. I-71 in Ohio between mile markers 0 and 36. I-74 in Ohio between mile markers 6 and 19. I-75 in Kentucky between mile markers 143 and 191. I-75 in Ohio between mile markers 0 and 32. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a sturdy building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 900 PM EDT for southeastern Indiana...northern Kentucky...and southwestern Ohio. To report hazardous weather conditions, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
